abstract: Many say the outcome of Rupert Murdoch’s $5 billion move on Dow Jones & Company was inevitable. But some unusual side transactions along the way to this week’s agreement are raising questions about how the Bancroft family, which controls the company through a special class of shares, was persuaded to support the deal.
lead_paragraph: Many say the outcome of Rupert Murdoch’s $5 billion move on Dow Jones & Company was inevitable. But some unusual side transactions along the way to this week’s agreement are raising questions about how the Bancroft family, which controls the company through a special class of shares, was persuaded to support the deal.

headline.main: The Side Deal in the Deal for Dow Jones
